name: SSS Sickness Benefit
summary: A daily cash allowance paid for the number of days a member is unable to work due to sickness or injury.
who_can_apply: All SSS members (Employed, Self-Employed, OFW, Voluntary) who have paid at least 3 months of contributions within the 12-month period before the semester of sickness.
how_to_apply: Submit notification through SSS website/mobile app or nearest SSS branch within 5 days of sickness

name: SSS Maternity Benefit
summary: Cash benefit for female SSS members who are unable to work due to childbirth, miscarriage, or emergency termination of pregnancy.
who_can_apply: Female SSS members who have paid at least 3 monthly contributions in the 12-month period before semester of childbirth/miscarriage
amount: 100% of average daily salary credit × 105 days (120 days for solo parents)
how_to_apply: Submit MAT-1 form to employer or SSS branch

name: SSS Unemployment Benefit
summary: Cash benefit for involuntarily separated employees (laid off, retrenched, or company closure).
who_can_apply: SSS members who were involuntarily separated from employment with at least 36 monthly contributions (12 of which within 18 months before separation)
amount: 50% of average monthly salary credit for 2-6 months
how_to_apply: Apply online via My.SSS portal within 1 year from separation

name: SSS Retirement Pension
summary: Monthly pension for members aged 60 (optional) or 65 (mandatory) who have paid at least 120 monthly contributions.
who_can_apply: SSS members aged 60+ (not employed) or 65+ with at least 120 monthly contributions
how_to_apply: File application 6 months before intended retirement date via SSS branch or online

name: Pag-IBIG Housing Loan
summary: Financing for the purchase of a residential lot, a house and lot, or for house construction or improvement.
who_can_apply: Active Pag-IBIG members with at least 24 monthly contributions. OFWs can also apply.
how_to_apply: Submit application at any Pag-IBIG branch or through accredited developers

name: Pag-IBIG MP2 Savings Program
summary: Voluntary savings program with higher dividends than regular Pag-IBIG savings (7-8% annual dividend rate).
who_can_apply: All Pag-IBIG members with at least 24 monthly contributions
how_to_apply: Register online via Virtual Pag-IBIG or at any branch

name: Pag-IBIG Calamity Loan
summary: Low-interest loan for members affected by calamities declared by the government.
who_can_apply: Active members residing or working in calamity-declared areas with at least 24 monthly contributions
amount: Up to 80% of Total Accumulated Values (TAV)
how_to_apply: Apply online or at nearest Pag-IBIG branch within 90 days of calamity declaration
requirements: Proof of residence/employment in affected area

name: DSWD AICS Program
summary: Assistance in Crisis Situations provides medical, burial, educational, and food assistance to individuals or families in crisis.
who_can_apply: Individuals/families who are poor, disadvantaged, or vulnerable and are facing a crisis, as assessed by a social worker.
amount: Medical: up to ₱50,000; Burial: up to ₱20,000; Education: up to ₱10,000
how_to_apply: Visit nearest DSWD office or satellite office with requirements
processing_time: Same day to 3 days depending on assessment

name: Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program (4Ps)
summary: Conditional cash transfer program for poorest families with health and education conditions.
who_can_apply: Households identified through Listahanan (National Household Targeting System) as poor
amount: ₱750/month per family for health; ₱300-700/month per child for education (max 3 children)
how_to_apply: Wait for selection through Listahanan survey (no direct application)

name: KALAHI-CIDSS Community Development
summary: Community-driven development program for barangay infrastructure projects.
who_can_apply: Poor municipalities identified by DSWD
amount: Varies per project (typically ₱300,000 to ₱1.5 million per barangay project)
how_to_apply: Through barangay assembly participation

name: Sustainable Livelihood Program (SLP)
summary: Microenterprise development and employment facilitation for poor families.
who_can_apply: 4Ps beneficiaries and Listahanan-identified poor families
amount: Seed capital fund: ₱15,000 per individual or ₱20,000 per family
how_to_apply: Through DSWD field offices

name: OWWA Educational Assistance (EDSP)
summary: Educational grant for qualified dependents of active OFW members.
who_can_apply: Qualified dependents of active OWWA members who passed the qualifying exam.
how_to_apply: Apply online through OWWA website during application period (usually March-May)

name: OWWA Enterprise Development Program
summary: Training and starter kits for OFWs and their families to start small businesses.
who_can_apply: Active OWWA members and their qualified dependents
how_to_apply: Register at OWWA regional offices

name: OWWA Repatriation Assistance
summary: Free repatriation for distressed OFWs including airfare and airport assistance.
who_can_apply: Distressed OFWs who are OWWA members
how_to_apply: Contact nearest Philippine Embassy/Consulate or OWWA 24/7 Operations Center

name: PhilHealth Konsulta Package
summary: Free primary care consultations, diagnostics, and medicines at accredited facilities.
who_can_apply: All PhilHealth members and their qualified dependents
how_to_apply: Register at Konsulta provider facility with PhilHealth ID

name: PhilHealth All Case Rates (50% Hike)
summary: Fixed coverage for hospital/medical procedures. Most rates increased by 50% effective 2025 to reduce out-of-pocket costs.
who_can_apply: Active PhilHealth members with qualifying contributions
amount: Varies (e.g., Pneumonia: ~₱29k; Stroke: ~₱57k - rates increased by 50%)
how_to_apply: Automatic deduction at accredited hospitals

name: PhilHealth Z Benefit Package
summary: Coverage for catastrophic illnesses including cancer treatments, kidney transplant, and heart surgeries.
who_can_apply: PhilHealth members diagnosed with covered conditions
amount: Up to ₱1.4M for breast cancer; up to ₱2.6M for kidney transplant
how_to_apply: Through accredited Z Benefit providers

name: DOLE TUPAD Program
summary: Emergency employment for displaced workers, underemployed, and seasonal workers for 10-30 days.
who_can_apply: Displaced workers, underemployed, unemployed (priority: 4Ps beneficiaries)
amount: Minimum wage rate for 10-30 days work
how_to_apply: Register at barangay or DOLE field office

name: Special Program for Employment of Students (SPES)
summary: Summer employment for poor students during vacation (20-52 days).
who_can_apply: Students 15-25 years old from poor families
amount: 60% of salary from DOLE, 40% from employer
how_to_apply: Apply at PESO office during enrollment period (January-March)
requirements: Parent's Income Tax Return/Certificate of Indigency

name: DOLE Adjustment Measures Program (CAMP)
summary: Financial assistance for workers affected by economic shocks (₱5,000 one-time).
who_can_apply: Workers affected by permanent closure or retrenchment
how_to_apply: Through employer's notice to DOLE or direct application

name: TESDA Training for Work Scholarship (TWSP)
summary: Free technical-vocational training with starter kits and assessment.
who_can_apply: Filipino citizens 15+ years old, HS graduate preferred
how_to_apply: Apply at TESDA centers or accredited training institutions

name: TESDA Special Training for Employment (STEP)
summary: Community-based skills training for specific job vacancies.
who_can_apply: Unemployed/underemployed Filipinos 18+ years old
how_to_apply: Register at TESDA or LGU offices

name: CHED UniFAST (Free College Education)
summary: Free tuition and miscellaneous fees in SUCs, LUCs, and CHED-recognized LCUs.
who_can_apply: Filipino students enrolled in undergraduate programs in SUCs/LUCs
how_to_apply: Automatic for qualified students in participating schools

name: Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES)
summary: Financial assistance for poor students in public and private HEIs.
who_can_apply: Poor Filipino students enrolled in CHED-recognized programs
how_to_apply: Apply through school's registrar during enrollment

name: LANDBANK KaTuwang sa Kabuhayan Program
summary: Loans for farmers, fisherfolk, and MSMEs at low interest rates.
who_can_apply: Farmers, fisherfolk, MSMEs with viable projects
how_to_apply: Apply at any LANDBANK branch

name: Rice Farmer Financial Assistance (RFFA)
summary: Unconditional cash assistance for rice farmers affected by tariffication and price fluctuations.
who_can_apply: Rice farmers cultivating 2 hectares or less, registered in RSBSA
how_to_apply: Automatic for RSBSA-registered farmers (via intervention monitoring card)

name: Pondo sa Pagbabago at Pag-Asenso (P3)
summary: Microfinance loan program for micro-enterprises at low interest (2.5% monthly).
who_can_apply: Micro-enterprises not qualified for bank loans
how_to_apply: Apply through partner microfinance institutions

name: DTI Negosyo Center Services
summary: Free business registration, training, and mentoring for MSMEs.
who_can_apply: All aspiring and existing entrepreneurs
how_to_apply: Visit nearest Negosyo Center

name: PCSO Medical Access Program (MAP/IMAP)
summary: Medical assistance for confinement, chemotherapy, dialysis, and medicines.
who_can_apply: Indigent Filipino patients (or their representatives)
amount: Varies by case (typically ₱10,000 to ₱50,000; higher for catastrophic cases)
how_to_apply: NCR: Online via PCSO E-Services; Provincial: Visit nearest PCSO Branch Office or Malasakit Center

name: Senior Citizen Benefits and Discounts
summary: 20% discount on medicines, food, transportation, utilities, and VAT exemption.
who_can_apply: Filipino citizens aged 60 and above
how_to_apply: Register at barangay/OSCA office for Senior Citizen ID

name: Social Pension for Indigent Senior Citizens
summary: ₱1,000 monthly pension for poor senior citizens without SSS/GSIS pension.
who_can_apply: Indigent senior citizens 60+ without pension
how_to_apply: Apply at OSCA/DSWD office

name: PWD Benefits and Discounts
summary: 20% discount on medicines, transportation, food, and priority lanes.
who_can_apply: Persons with disabilities certified by DOH
how_to_apply: Register at PDAO office for PWD ID

name: NHA Resettlement Program
summary: Housing for informal settlers and families affected by government projects.
who_can_apply: ISFs, disaster victims, families affected by government projects
how_to_apply: Through LGU endorsement or NHA regional offices

name: DOH Malasakit Center
summary: One-stop shop for medical assistance from PCSO, DSWD, PhilHealth, and DOH in government hospitals.
who_can_apply: Indigent and financially-incapacitated patients
how_to_apply: Visit Malasakit Center in DOH hospitals

name: DepEd Senior High School Voucher Program
summary: Financial assistance for Grade 11-12 students in private schools.
who_can_apply: JHS completers from public schools enrolling in private SHS
how_to_apply: Apply during enrollment at participating private schools

name: Service Contracting Program for PUV Drivers
summary: ₱10,000 monthly assistance for PUV drivers affected by route rationalization.
who_can_apply: Registered PUV drivers/operators in modernization program
how_to_apply: Register through transport cooperative or LTFRB

name: SSS Disability Benefit
summary: Monthly pension or lump sum for members who become permanently disabled (partial or total) due to sickness or injury.
who_can_apply: SSS members with at least 36 monthly contributions (12 within the semester before disability) who are permanently disabled
amount: Monthly pension (if 36+ contributions) or lump sum (if less than 36 contributions)
how_to_apply: File disability claim at nearest SSS branch with medical evaluation

name: SSS Death and Funeral Benefit
summary: Cash benefit for beneficiaries upon death of an SSS member. Includes funeral grant and monthly pension for primary beneficiaries.
who_can_apply: Primary beneficiaries (spouse, dependent children) or secondary beneficiaries of deceased SSS members
amount: Funeral: ₱20,000 to ₱60,000 (based on contributions); Pension: Minimum ₱2,000/month
how_to_apply: File death claim at nearest SSS branch or online via My.SSS

name: Pag-IBIG Multi-Purpose Loan (MPL)
summary: Low-interest loan for any purpose - medical emergencies, education, home improvement, livelihood, or personal needs.
who_can_apply: Active Pag-IBIG members with at least 24 monthly contributions
amount: Up to 80% of Total Accumulated Value (TAV), maximum ₱600,000
how_to_apply: Apply online via Virtual Pag-IBIG or at any branch

name: Solo Parent Benefits (RA 8972)
summary: Benefits for solo parents including work flexibility, parental leave, educational and livelihood assistance.
who_can_apply: Solo parents (widowed, separated, single, abandoned) with children under 18 or with disability
amount: 7-day parental leave; discounts on government transactions; priority in livelihood programs
how_to_apply: Register at local DSWD or Social Welfare office for Solo Parent ID

name: GSIS Retirement Benefits
summary: Monthly pension for government employees who have rendered at least 15 years of service upon reaching retirement age.
who_can_apply: Government employees (national/local) with at least 15 years of service, aged 60-65
amount: Based on years of service and average monthly compensation (minimum ₱5,000/month)
how_to_apply: File application through agency HR or directly at GSIS office 6 months before retirement

name: GSIS Emergency Loan (eCard Plus)
summary: Quick emergency loan for active government employees, disbursed through GSIS eCard.
who_can_apply: Active GSIS members with at least 3 months of service and contributions
how_to_apply: Apply online via GSIS website or mobile app

name: Free WiFi for All Program
summary: Free internet access in public places nationwide.
who_can_apply: All Filipinos (public access)
how_to_apply: Connect to @FreeWiFi@Gov networks in public areas

name: DFA Passport Assistance for OFWs
summary: Express passport processing for documented OFWs (7 working days).
who_can_apply: Documented OFWs with employment contracts
how_to_apply: Online appointment with OFW lane selection

name: Blue Badge Parking Privilege
summary: Designated parking spaces for PWDs and senior citizens in Metro Manila.
who_can_apply: PWDs and senior citizens with vehicles
how_to_apply: Apply at MMDA or LGU offices

name: Walang Gutom 2027: Food Stamp Program
summary: Electronic benefit transfer (EBT) cards for food-poor households to purchase nutritious food items.
who_can_apply: Households classified as 'food poor' by DSWD Listahanan (income <₱8,000/mo)
how_to_apply: Wait for Listahanan assessment and DSWD validation (Pilot areas: NCR, CARAGA, BARMM, etc.)

name: PhilHealth Outpatient Mental Health Package
summary: Coverage for general mental health services, including consultations, diagnostics, and medicines.
who_can_apply: All active PhilHealth members and dependents
how_to_apply: Consult at accredited Mental Health Outpatient providers
